resources.string: In this case, we are connecting to a gateway where server certificate is already expired. We are using a different msso file which points to such gateway.The msso file which is used for this purpose is dynamically configured.

We are adding a certificate inside the raw folder.The source of certificate is different from the current gateway. It has a different hostname. We are extracting the subject DN and using it to connect the endpoint. As a result, it will check the hostname and throw the error for the same
Here we are calling the endpoint after enabling/disabling the ssl pinning. If you toggle the switch to on/off, then SslPinning will be enable/disable.
Here we are calling the endpoint after disabling the ssl pinning.
We are calling an endpoint (retrieveFlights) after successful login. After calling, it returns few flight details.

This application, based on layer7 Mobile SDK checks the various certificate validation and verification features. The app checks the certificate hostname verification, server certificate expiry, different validation for chain trust etc.
In this case, The pinning mode is set to Intermediate pinning mode and the certificates from the security configuration or msso config file are verified with server Certificates.

In this case, The pinning mode is set to All certificates pinning mode and all the certificates from the server will be verified against the certificates from the security configuration or msso config file.
In this case, The public key hashes from security configuration are verified against server certificate public key hashes.
All Public key hashes are verified.
